column3:
### Gitian builds | File | commit dce6f3b29b4197b8eea91f5919d56eb222ea8959
(master) | commit 8a62b9f52bdedb31ee9603983b813e9d5c4110bd
(master and this pull) | |--|--|--| | bitcoin-0.19.99-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz | [`4fba473976a3a85e...`](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/dce6f3b29b4197b8eea91f5919d56eb222ea8959/bitcoin-0.19.99-
> Nit: `URL_DECODE` should probably be named `g_url_decode_fn` or something...\n\nConstant naming is used because it is a constant, not a global variable
> Constant naming is used because it is a constant, not a global variable\n\n`G_URL_DECODE` like `G_TRANSLATION_FUN` :grimacing: ?
`G_URL_DECODE_FUN` sounds better in that case...\n\nBut it's not really a constant - its value varies between builds.
The docs say "compile time constants", not "build time constants"
Anyway, I was mostly joking about that style nit. Let's not hold back this pull based on naming guidelines.
It's definitely not a compile time constant! ;)
> It's definitely not a compile time constant! ;)\n\nFWIW, following this up in #18568

Concept ACK, but wouldn't it be easier to implement `std::string urlDecode(const std::string &urlEncoded)` without `evhttp_uridecode`?\n\nIt has always seemed weird to me that we depend on third-party code for such a trivial function :)

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #18571 (fuzz: Disable debug log file by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to re
Shouldn't this be #ifdef URL_DECODE, ie: on bitcoin-tx the symbol does not exist if libevent is not used.
